conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source position
Four shadows labeled A, B, C, and D cast by four objects
Light source creates distinct shadows on the ground
Moving light source backward changes angle of light hitting objects
Shadows elongate and shift in position when light source moves backward
Shadow A is relatively small and close to the object
Shadow A will elongate and move further away when light source moves backward
Shadow B is small and compact
Shadow B will elongate and shift position, becoming larger
Shadow C is elongated, indicating tall object or distant light source
Shadow C will become longer and shift further away
Shadow D is triangular and relatively small
Shadow D will elongate and shift position
In second image, shadows have elongated and shifted position
Shadows become larger and move further from objects due to light angle change
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D elongate and shift position when light source moves backward
